claims.text: A three-day juice cleanse can bolster the immune system and aid fat loss.
claims.context: Speaker discusses benefits of juice cleanse for health.

claims.text: Research out of California supports the effectiveness of a juice cleanse for fat loss and immune support.
claims.context: Claims based on research from California.

claims.text: Green juice can lower insulin levels when made correctly.
claims.context: Speaker emphasizes the importance of insulin control.

claims.text: A juice cleanse can increase human growth hormone levels.
claims.context: Claims about hormone increase during juice cleanse.

claims.text: Detoxing during a juice cleanse helps eliminate toxins released from fat.
claims.context: Discusses detoxification benefits of juice cleanse.

claims.text: Autophagy occurs during a juice cleanse, recycling old cells and materials.
claims.context: Speaker highlights autophagy as a key benefit.

claims.text: The digestive system expends more energy than any other activity, including marathons.
claims.context: Claims about energy expenditure of the digestive system.

claims.text: 70% of the immune system is made up of the gut microbiome.
claims.context: Discusses the connection between gut health and immunity.

claims.text: Green apples are preferred for juice because they have lower sugar content than red apples.
claims.context: Speaker advises on apple selection for juice.

claims.text: Celery is beneficial for the digestive tract and liver detoxification.
Parsley juice has more iron than spinach and helps with anemia.
Dandelion has a detox effect and is good for iron levels.
Drinking 64 to 128 ounces of juice is recommended during a juice cleanse.
claims.context: Guidelines for juice intake during cleanse.

claims.text: Broth and collagen are insulin-friendly additions to a juice cleanse.
claims.context: Discusses compatible foods during juice cleanse.

claims.text: The speaker encourages doing a juice cleanse once a month.

input_prompt:
Claim: Celery is beneficial for the digestive tract and liver detoxification.
Category: health
Extraction confidence: 0.75

Evidence:
UNCLEAR (3 sources):
  1. Hepatoprotective effect of feeding celery leaves mixed with chicory ... | reliability=high (1.00)
     URL: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC3113355/
     Summary: Feeding plant combination of celery, chicory, and barley at 15% concentration (5% from each) was more effective in decreasing the elevation of liver enzymes ( ...
  2. Benefits of Celery Juice: What You Need to Know - Healthline | reliability=high (0.85)
     URL: https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/celery-juice-cleanse
     Summary: Finally, there is no evidence that celery juice detoxifies your body, as another popular claim states. Your body has its own natural ...
  3. Celery Juice Benefits: Is It Healthy? - Health Cleveland Clinic | reliability=medium (0.60)
     URL: https://health.clevelandclinic.org/celery-juice-is-a-trendy-detox-drink-but-does-it-actually-have-benefits
     Summary: Celery juice has gained popularity for its potential health benefits, including hydration, nutrient richness and anti-inflammatory properties.

Provide the structured verdict.

output.summary: The evidence presents mixed signals regarding celery's benefits for the digestive tract and liver detoxification. A high-reliability study indicates that a combination of celery and other plants may help reduce liver enzyme elevation, suggesting some hepatoprotective effects. However, Healthline explicitly states that there is no evidence supporting the claim that celery juice detoxifies the body, while the Cleveland Clinic acknowledges its potential health benefits but does not confirm detoxification.

input_prompt:
Claim: The speaker encourages doing a juice cleanse once a month.
Category: health
Extraction confidence: 0.80

Evidence:
UNCLEAR (5 sources):
  1. Juicing: What are the health benefits? - Mayo Clinic | reliability=high (0.85)
     URL: https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/expert-answers/juicing/faq-20058020
     Summary: These are called juice cleanses or fasts. Some of these diets may claim to help remove toxins, aid digestion or lead to weight loss. But no ...
  2. 8 Best Juice Cleanses of 2025, Reviewed by Dietitians - Byrdie | reliability=medium (0.60)
     URL: https://www.byrdie.com/best-juice-cleanses-4800007
     Summary: Our Top Picks · Best Overall: Raw Generation · Best Value: Suja · Best Variety: Lemonkind · Best Organic: Raw Juicery · Best Cold-Pressed: Pressed ...
  3. Cleanse 1 - Beginner Juice Cleanse Reset for Digestion & Hydration | reliability=medium (0.60)
     URL: https://pressed.com/products/first-time-juice-cleanse?srsltid=AfmBOopEATknxlJtheUV6-vfF5ubeWO7maODjnFYOVRo0mcWjIdNiQAb
     Summary: Cleanse 1 is a beginner-friendly full-day juice cleanse with fruit-forward blends to support digestion, fuel hydration, and refresh with a gentle gut reset.
  4. Are Juice Cleanses Actually Good for You? - Houston Methodist | reliability=unknown (0.50)
     URL: https://www.houstonmethodist.org/blog/articles/2020/jan/are-juices-cleanses-actually-good-for-you/
     Summary: "Studies have shown that fruit and vegetable juices can boost levels of important vitamins and antioxidants, including folate, vitamin C, ...
  5. Everything You Need to Know About Starting a Juice Cleanse | reliability=unknown (0.50)
     URL: https://www.baltimoremagazine.com/section/health/juice-cleanse-benefits-tips-tricks/
     Summary: The benefits vary among individuals, [but] general advantages of this practice may encompass weight loss, mental clarity, improved digestion, detoxification, ...

Provide the structured verdict.

output.summary: The evidence regarding juice cleanses is mixed and lacks a clear consensus. The Mayo Clinic notes that while juice cleanses may claim benefits like detoxification and weight loss, they do not endorse them as necessary or beneficial. Other sources discuss potential benefits but do not specifically support the idea of a monthly cleanse.

     Summary: Parsley contains vitamins B1, B2, C, and K. Oils extracted from parsley contain chemicals that might help stimulate the appetite, improve digestion, and have ...

     Summary: Fe: Liver, avocado, broccoli, spinach, parsley YARUNIV Studio ... in iron, with 2 mg per quarter-cup. Toss back a handful as a snack or ...

     URL: https://www.eatingwell.com/foods-with-more-iron-than-spinach-11852100
     Summary: Dietitians reveal iron-rich foods that include more of the crucial nutrient than a serving of spinach. Plus, tips for how to enjoy them.
  5. 6 Blood-Building Herbs for Iron Deficiency - Jenna Volpe | reliability=medium (0.60)
     URL: https://wholeisticliving.com/2022/06/16/herbs-for-iron-deficiency/
     Summary: From a micronutrient standpoint, parsley is loaded with vitamins A, K, and C as well as minerals like iron, magnesium, and potassium. What is ...
  6. Parsley for Iron Absorption: Benefits, Risks & Research - Parade | reliability=medium (0.60)
     URL: https://parade.com/health/herb-for-iron-absorption-according-to-registered-dietitians
     Summary: Parsley can help with iron absorption and, in some cases, hinder it. Registered dietitians shared insights on parsley and iron absorption.

output.summary: The evidence regarding parsley juice's iron content compared to spinach is mixed and unclear. While some sources suggest parsley contains iron, they do not definitively state it has more than spinach. Additionally, the role of parsley in aiding anemia is not clearly supported, with some sources indicating it may help with iron absorption but also potentially hinder it.
